text: Sometimes you need to be alone to reflect on life.
author: Anonymous

text: It is better to be alone than in bad company.
author: George Washington

text: The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: I think it's very healthy to spend time alone. You need to know how to be alone and not be defined by another person.
author: Olivia Wilde

text: Loneliness is not lack of company, loneliness is lack of purpose.
author: Guillermo Maldonado

text: Being alone has a power that very few people can handle.
author: Steven Aitchison

text: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The time you feel lonely is the time you most need to be by yourself.
author: Douglas Coupland

text: All cruelty springs from weakness.
author: Seneca

text: The soul that sees beauty may sometimes walk alone.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: I restore myself when I'm alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: Solitude is where I place my chaos to rest and awaken my inner peace.
author: Nikki Rowe

text: The best part about being alone is that you really don't have to answer to anybody. You do what you want.
author: Justin Timberlake

text: I never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: Learn to be alone and to like it. There is nothing more freeing and empowering than learning to like your own company.
author: Mandy Hale

text: The person who knows how to laugh at himself will never cease to be amused.
author: Shirley MacLaine

text: Alone time is when I distance myself from the voices of the world so I can hear my own.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: I think it's good for a person to spend time alone. It gives them an opportunity to discover who they are.
author: Amy Grant

text: The strongest man in the world is he who stands most alone.
author: Henrik Ibsen

text: Solitude is independence.
author: Hermann Hesse

text: Being alone never felt right. Sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.
author: Charles Bukowski

text: The capacity to be alone is the capacity to love. It may look paradoxical to you, but it's not.
author: Osho
